summary: The Reproductive Empowerment and Support Through Optimal Restoration Act (RESTORE Act) aims to expand research and data collection on reproductive health conditions, including endometriosis, PCOS, and infertility. It promotes training for medical professionals in restorative reproductive medicine (which emphasizes natural methods), prohibits discrimination against healthcare providers who do not participate in assisted reproductive technology, and expands access to restorative reproductive medicine through Title X funding and other programs. The bill also addresses male infertility, modernizes medical coding for restorative treatments, and expands research on related topics.
